question: If you were to graph the inequality x < -7 (read as: x is less than negative 7) on a number line, what would it look like? W) It would have an open circle at -7 and a ray extending from -7 on the right to negative infinity on the left X) It would have a closed circle at -7 and a ray extending from -7 on the right to negative infinity on the left Y) It would have an open circle at 7 and a ray extending from 7 on the right to negative infinity on the left Z) It would have open circles at -7 and 7 and be shaded in between them
answer:
W) IT WOULD HAVE AN OPEN CIRCLE AT -7 AND A RAY EXTENDING FROM -7
ON THE RIGHT TO NEGATIVE INFINITY ON THE LEFT
